meanings.definition: A person who writes out documents by hand.
meanings.sent1: The scriveners meticulously copied the ancient manuscript.
meanings.sent2: In the past, scriveners were essential for creating legal documents.
meanings.sent3: The scriveners had a race to see who could write the fastest!
meanings.sent4: The scriveners' hands moved like lightning as they transcribed the text.
meanings.sent5: The scriveners' precise handwriting made the document look elegant.

meanings.definition: A person who copies or transcribes documents.
meanings.sent1: My grandfather worked as a scrivener, copying letters for the town.
meanings.sent2: The scriveners in the library diligently transcribed the old manuscripts.
meanings.sent3: The scriveners had a friendly competition to see who could copy the most pages.
meanings.sent4: The scriveners' pens danced across the paper, replicating the text perfectly.
meanings.sent5: The scriveners' job required great attention to detail and accuracy.

meanings.sent1: The scriveners at the royal court were highly skilled in calligraphy.
meanings.sent2: During medieval times, scriveners were in high demand for their services.
meanings.sent3: The scriveners joked that their ink bottles were their best friends.
meanings.sent4: The scriveners' quills were like extensions of their own hands.
meanings.sent5: The scriveners' expertise in copying texts was unmatched in the kingdom.
